definition: a building where young people receive education, swim in or form a large group of fish
details:
noun
- a building where young people receive education
= example: a building where young people receive education
= synonyms: schoolhouse
- the process of being formally educated at a school
= example: the process of being formally educated at a school
= synonyms: schooling
- a large group of fish
= example: a large group of fish
= synonyms: shoal
- a body of creative artists or writers or thinkers linked by a similar style or by similar teachers
= example: a body of creative artists or writers or thinkers linked by a similar style or by similar teachers
- an educational institution
= example: an educational institution
- an educational institution's faculty and students
= example: an educational institution's faculty and students
- the period of instruction in a school
= example: the period of instruction in a school
= synonyms: schooltime
verb
- swim in or form a large group of fish
= example: swim in or form a large group of fish
- educate in or as if in a school
= example: educate in or as if in a school
- teach or refine to be discriminative in taste or judgment
= synonyms: train
